Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Stigmurin (natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence  is 88.2% similar toscorpion AMP TsAP-1.Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC 29213 or MRSA ATCC 33591 (MIC 8.68-17.37 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 122225 (MIC 9.38 uM), E.faecalis ATCC 4028 (MIC >150 uM), E.coli ATCC 25922 (MIC >139 uM), E.cloacae ATCC 13047 (MIC> 150 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC>150 uM), yeasts C. albicans ATCC 90028 (MIC 34.75 uM), C. krusei  ATCC 6258 (MIC 69.5->150 uM), and C. glabrata ATCC 90030 (MIC 69.5->150 uM).Cytotoxicity: 20% hemolysis at 139.5 uM (less hemo.lytic), 50% killing of SiHa cells between 69.8-139.5 uM and of Vero E6 cells at 139.5 uM.Animal model:mouse:It promotes wound healing infected with S. aureus ATCC 29213.Structure: CD curves are helical in TFE and SDS. The NMR study also in a TFE/water mixture (40:60) reveals a helical conformation for residues 7-16, while the N-terminal residues 1-6 are disordered (Alessandra Daniele-Silva et al. 2021).Updated 7/2021; 5/2024; 10/2024/p>
Literature Information.Author: Melo ET, Estrela AB, Santos EC, Machado PR, Farias KJ, Torres TM, de Carvalho E, Lima JP, Silva-JÃºnior AA, Barbosa EG, Fernandes-Pedrosa MF. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Structural characterization of a novel peptide with antimicrobial activity from the venom gland of the scorpion Tityus stigmurus: Stigmurin
